description: Smallest integer m such that the product of every 3 consecutive integers > m has a prime factor > prime(n).
references: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: E. F. Ecklund and R. B. Eggleton, Prime factors of consecutive integers, Amer. Math. Monthly, 79 (1972), 1082-1089.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
